issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: It is currently possible for e.g. two sides of a union (or a join for that matter) to have slightly different priorities. We don't want to preempt running tasks on one side in favor of the other side in such cases.
fields.summary: LLAP Tez scheduler - only preempt tasks if there's a dependency between them

comments.body:
A patch. I didn't have time to test it cause I have to run an errand now :) It does compile.  WIll test later :)
[~ewohlstadter]  can you take a look?
[~sseth] [~gopalv]  I'd also need a binding plus-one, or you could even review :P
[~ewohlstadter] I cannot find you on RB, it's https://reviews.apache.org/r/64787/

ATTACHMENT ID: 12903318 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build
Hmm, I checked on the cluster and that is actually correct... DAG info is null everywhere including start call. That is not great cause we'd need sync to init this elsewhere.
Updated the patch. With some added logging (that is not included in the final patch) I can see on a union query the preemption is prevented between two sides of the union.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12904271 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build
Committed to master; thanks for the reviews
Reverted the patch, looks like it breaks in some cases. I am looking; it appears that dag info doesn't have the entire dag, or smth like that, for some combination of union and multi-insert
Updated; didn't realize the plugin was reused.
[~jdere] can you look at the update? small addendum to fix the issue https://reviews.apache.org/r/64787/diff/2-3/
Forgot to submit patch...

[~sseth] I don't think it's the only place where we depend on that... anyway, yeah, ideally it should be exposed properly. Does it have to be as part of the major JIRA, or can we make an API specific change?

On DAG itself - I think this is the only place. That's a core component internal to Tez. I would be very careful about depending on this. I know there's other places where Tez internals are used - they're mostly from the runtime though.
I think a Tez API specific change can be made. In fact TEZ-3770 will likely go in without API changes, which I had asked for there as well.

| (x) *{color:red}-1 overall{color}* |
